Author: ca333#0118
Content: No problem. Rest all assured that Antara Composer is a great and reliable service. It is fully automated and there is 0 downtime. The underlying infrastructure shows 100% uptime for all servers/p2p-nodes related to  https://composer.kmd.io/c/COMMOD - Composer uses the AWS API for the key operations. For the dpow'd chain networks itself we ensure there are at least 60 additional & independent p2p nodes available to form a truly decentralized network.

Author: ca333#0118
Content: ok i guess i know it just by logic - client bought explorer on monthly subscription - then did not pay/upgrade next month and had to buy the service again after expiration. In this case you get a new explorer server. Pretty sure this happened.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
I think this post might also be relevant here so I'm copy and pasting from #komodo-team. It's a tweet by Internet Wayback machine about letting family and friends save deceased people's tweets from being deleted by Twitter based on the new terms of service. I'm wondering if this would be possible using Antara Composer.

`Hey team, it might be a cool idea marketing wise and also to showcase what can be done with Antara, to build an Antara smartchain to put these tweets on a blockchain. We could throw an explorer up that lets people view their deceased friend's and family's twitters and give it over to the Internet Wayback Machine. Make the nodes public so others can contribute to maintaining it, and make the blocks mined on demand (when new people are added)`

https://twitter.com/internetarchive/status/1201707491387510784?s=20

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Or it could run hand in hand with Wayback Machine where they save the tweets like they would normally, and they add a link to their page that shows the tweet on an block explorer. Plenty of ways to cut this, but might be a cool marketing/proof of concept idea.
